etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in The Monthly Magazine and British Register. From French philomatique from ancient Greek ϕιλομάθεια, ϕιλομαθία love of learning + French -ique

definitions: Of, belonging to, or consisting of philomaths; relating or devoted to mathematics, natural philosophy, etc.

notes.text: Originally and chiefly in the names of learned societies.
